title: Nautilus 79
paragraphs: The Nautilus 79 is a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3. It is a variant of the Nautilus 47 with a different look and loadout.
The Nautilus 79 is similar in appearance to the Nautilus 47. However, all the metal parts are slightly darker, and the rim of the shell and the handhold are outlined in gold.
The Nautilus 79 was released on 5 December 2018 at 02:00 UTC[1]. It comes with Suction Bombs and the Inkjet. It also has the ability to store a charge for up to 3â…“ seconds.
- While Main Power Up increases the number of shots fired, it does not increase the ink consumption relative to the amount charged, making the weapon comparatively more ink efficient.
The Nautilus 79 returns in Splatoon 3 as part of the Fresh Season 2024 update. Its kit consists of Suction Bombs and the Triple Splashdown.

For competitive tips about the Nautilus 79
- According to dataminers, in Splatoon 2, the Nautilus 79's kit consisted of Splat Bomb and Ink Armor prior to its release, but this was changed upon its release in version 4.3.0.
Nautilus refers to the weapon's resemblance to the shell of a mollusc of the same name and 79 is the atomic number of gold, referring the weapon's gold coloration.
